snippet.textDisplay: Western movie studios are starting to take anime/ video-game adaptations seriously. Last year we got what many people said was the best live-action American anime adaptation ever with Alita: Battle Angel and this year it’s Sonic. Directors like Robert Rodriguez are giving these unapologetic anime/ video-game fans very few reasons to condemn them for ruining their favorite franchises.
snippet.textOriginal: Western movie studios are starting to take anime/ video-game adaptations seriously. Last year we got what many people said was the best live-action American anime adaptation ever with Alita: Battle Angel and this year it’s Sonic. Directors like Robert Rodriguez are giving these unapologetic anime/ video-game fans very few reasons to condemn them for ruining their favorite franchises.

snippet.textDisplay: The movie was literally Sonic 1; It was awesome when I went to see it yesterday: 9/10 due to the strong faithfulness of it's Sonic history references and allusions as well as Jim Carrey's legendary "comedic insanity" performance as Robotnik, but then changed to 10/10 due to considering the plot being original to some degree as well as a question that came to my mind regarding Sonic's origins of his iconic speed ability. Finally change it once more to 11/10 due to Tails appearing and a sequel coming in the end.
snippet.textOriginal: The movie was literally Sonic 1; It was awesome when I went to see it yesterday: 9/10 due to the strong faithfulness of it's Sonic history references and allusions as well as Jim Carrey's legendary "comedic insanity" performance as Robotnik, but then changed to 10/10 due to considering the plot being original to some degree as well as a question that came to my mind regarding Sonic's origins of his iconic speed ability. Finally change it once more to 11/10 due to Tails appearing and a sequel coming in the end.

snippet.textDisplay: The main problem of this movie is  that everybody forgot that sonic didn't stop on the Genesis/mega drive. Sonic adventure is a game from 1998 with about hours of cutscenes and a good story (and weird writing like every single game from that era because voice acting was something new for the industry). Everybody involved on this movie or reviewing it just talk about sonic 1 & 2 and even ignore sonic 3 that the plot was about an island floating on the sky guarded by the last of the echidnas and inside the island there is giant crystal that is "an egg of a dragon". Why people are not even raising the possibility of a movie about any of it? Or the story of chaos and the destruction of the echidnas 3000 years ago from adventure 1(1998) or the mystery of a space colony that was abandoned for 50 years from adventure 2(2001)? Why any of this is a possibility for a movie? I just want a video game movie that has the plot of the video game, not trying to put gameplay element, like rings, because it was what the writer saw on a video on youtube of the first game of the franchise.
snippet.textOriginal: The main problem of this movie is  that everybody forgot that sonic didn't stop on the Genesis/mega drive. Sonic adventure is a game from 1998 with about hours of cutscenes and a good story (and weird writing like every single game from that era because voice acting was something new for the industry). Everybody involved on this movie or reviewing it just talk about sonic 1 & 2 and even ignore sonic 3 that the plot was about an island floating on the sky guarded by the last of the echidnas and inside the island there is giant crystal that is "an egg of a dragon". Why people are not even raising the possibility of a movie about any of it? Or the story of chaos and the destruction of the echidnas 3000 years ago from adventure 1(1998) or the mystery of a space colony that was abandoned for 50 years from adventure 2(2001)? Why any of this is a possibility for a movie? I just want a video game movie that has the plot of the video game, not trying to put gameplay element, like rings, because it was what the writer saw on a video on youtube of the first game of the franchise.

snippet.textDisplay:
Metroid: Other M happened. I don't want a Metroid movie, because it will be more of that.

It'll be someone trying to impose their own ideas onto Samus' character, because at the end of the day, she didn't really have a lot of character. She was just kind of this stoic, implacable force of destruction. And that was fine, for the games. But it doesn't make for a good movie protagonist, I don't think. And yet paradoxically, diverting from that breaks the lore, as we saw in Other M. That paradox is a recipe for disaster unless you had someone who really understands about her character and how she is presented, and had a way to translate her stoicism to a completely different medium in a believable way. And that sounds like a real tightrope walk.
snippet.textOriginal:
Metroid: Other M happened. I don't want a Metroid movie, because it will be more of that. 

It'll be someone trying to impose their own ideas onto Samus' character, because at the end of the day, she didn't really have a lot of character. She was just kind of this stoic, implacable force of destruction. And that was fine, for the games. But it doesn't make for a good movie protagonist, I don't think. And yet paradoxically, diverting from that breaks the lore, as we saw in Other M. That paradox is a recipe for disaster unless you had someone who really understands about her character and how she is presented, and had a way to translate her stoicism to a completely different medium in a believable way. And that sounds like a real tightrope walk.

snippet.textDisplay:
The user reviews are right. This is a very good Sonic movie. I smiled all the way through the film.

It's really heart warming to watch

The chemistry between Sonic and donut lord is done well.

The source material, even the fan's source material are being respected here

The repurposed ring makes sense for the movie

The performances and action is great

The redesign is also perfect

The new origin story for Sonic fits well to the character

Please watch this guys. support this film. So we can show that if the studios care about us, we'll care about them. Also i want a sequel :)
snippet.textOriginal:
The user reviews are right. This is a very good Sonic movie. I smiled all the way through the film. 

It's really heart warming to watch

 The chemistry between Sonic and donut lord is done well.

The source material, even the fan's source material are being respected here

The repurposed ring makes sense for the movie

The performances and action is great

The redesign is also perfect

The new origin story for Sonic fits well to the character

Please watch this guys. support this film. So we can show that if the studios care about us, we'll care about them. Also i want a sequel :)

snippet.textDisplay: eat the bat soup biggot  I have said this time and time again and I think it applys here. When you adapt comic book or video game adaptations it changes when it translates to the big movie screen. Things change, even though Shadow might've been created by Eggmans GF, they'll probably just make Eggman the sole creator of Shadow. Hollywood has brilliant writers who will rework the sonic lore and source material to make sense of it for they end product. The reason I said Shadow makes sense For me logically is that. I didnt get how you would get a sonic robot from a strand of sonics DNA. But now as I'm writing this comment.. I saw a sonic clip earlier where Dr. Eggman was able power his aircraft or technology with Sonics hair follicle. Now it totally makes sense to me that Robot sonic will probably be making an appearance in Sonic 2 and not the latter in Shadow. I think what will happen is.. Robot Sonic will be defeated and then, Eggman will resort to making Shadow.
snippet.textOriginal: eat the bat soup biggot  I have said this time and time again and I think it applys here. When you adapt comic book or video game adaptations it changes when it translates to the big movie screen. Things change, even though Shadow might've been created by Eggmans GF, they'll probably just make Eggman the sole creator of Shadow. Hollywood has brilliant writers who will rework the sonic lore and source material to make sense of it for they end product. The reason I said Shadow makes sense For me logically is that. I didnt get how you would get a sonic robot from a strand of sonics DNA. But now as I'm writing this comment.. I saw a sonic clip earlier where Dr. Eggman was able power his aircraft or technology with Sonics hair follicle. Now it totally makes sense to me that Robot sonic will probably be making an appearance in Sonic 2 and not the latter in Shadow. I think what will happen is.. Robot Sonic will be defeated and then, Eggman will resort to making Shadow.

snippet.textDisplay: I'm actually looking forward to see this movie! Think I might see it next week sometime. It's great to see that they actually changed the model too. There's an animated mortal kombat movie that's coming out that sounds dope af can't wait for that! The pikachu movie was also good as well I thought.
